documentType: bureau of prisons count sheet and assignment roster
summary: This document consists of official Bureau of Prisons forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 10, 2019. It includes an out-count sheet listing inmate totals by housing unit and a separate roster showing inmate assignments, specifically noting four inmates on suicide watch. The documents appear to be routine prison administrative records from the day Jeffrey Epstein died.

persons.name: BULLOCK

events.title: MCC New York Daily Count and Assignments
events.description: Routine administrative count of inmates and assignment of four inmates to hospital/suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC.

An inmate roster shows four inmates (BULLOCK, SANTANA, WALKER, WOOLASTON) assigned to HOSP (hospital) with the operational category 'SUICIDE OWASSO' or 'SUICIDE R', indicating they were on suicide watch.
The main count sheet records a total inmate population of 758 at the MCC, verified as 754.
The documents are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative forms (Count Sheet and Assignment Roster).
The records provide a snapshot of prison operations and inmate assignments on a highly significant date in the Epstein case.
